definitions.definition: a flat piece of metal, usually like a coin in shape, that is given to the winner of a competition or to somebody who has been brave, for example in war

examples.text: to win a gold medal in the Olympics
to award a medal for bravery
He won a gold medal in the 100 metres.
Her medal hopes were dashed by injury.
He received a medal for his service in the war.
She is one of our best hopes for an Olympic medal.
That brings Britain's medal haul to six—two golds, three silvers and a bronze.
Anyone who does that job deserves a medal!

definitions.definition: used to say that you admire somebody because they have done something difficult or unpleasant

examples.text: She deserves a medal for teaching those 5-year-olds all day!

wordOrigin: late 16th cent.: from French médaille, from Italian medaglia, from medieval Latin medalia ‘half a denarius’ (ancient Roman silver coin), from Latin medialis ‘medial’.
